title: Introducing: Hop Along
body:
Frances Quinlan sounds like she’s always almost about collapse.

It doesn’t matter what she’s yelling, whether it’s the [obsessive-destructive](https://www.facebook.com/pages/Hop-Along-the-band/303587787250?fref=ts "I'm too good at this now. ") _“nobody deserves you the way that I do”_, or [bottomlessly sad](http://hopalong.bandcamp.com/track/diamond-mine "I'll bet. ") like _“there are some parents whose child__ren long for divorce”,_ or [getting hopeful](http://hopalong.bandcamp.com/track/no-good-al-joad "I think. ") with _“you are my favourite because you’re a long shot”_. It doesn’t matter whether she’s chucking out [playground taunts](http://hopalong.bandcamp.com/track/kids-on-the-boardwalk "Genuinely hilarious. ") like _“my mom says your mom’s a lesbian__”_ over a pure pop piano stomp, or turning [the nonsensical](http://hopalong.bandcamp.com/track/laments "I don't ever want to know what this means. ") _“the mattress-maker’s making his livin’ by the minute”_ into the most necessary sentence you’ve ever heard while guitars go napalm and someone approximates a kid hammering at a keyboard. It doesn’t matter if she’s just barely breathing about [trouble finding her sleeping](http://hopalong.bandcamp.com/track/trouble-found-me "It will. ") and her subsequent journey downstairs, unspecified dread lurking just at the edge of everything. Frances Quinlan has a way of making everything sound like it’s the last thing she’ll ever sing.

With Mark Quinlan and Tyler Long, Frances Quinlan sings and plays guitar in a band from Philadelphia called **Hop Along**, whose debut full-length  _**Get Disowned**_  is one of the most wonderful, peculiar, addictive, lopsided, explosive collections of songs in an unspecified subgenre of rock music that I have heard in a long, long, long time.

_**Get Disowned**_  is out now via [Big Scary Monsters](http://bsmrocks.bigcartel.com/product/hop-along-get-disowned-lp "Terrifying. "). Hop Along play the [Old Blue Last](https://www.facebook.com/events/103290126522634/?fref=ts "Laters.") tonight with The Sidekicks, Muncie Girls and Plaids.
